law.catch_line: Jurisdiction of Circuit Court -- Court of record and of continuous session.

text.section: The Circuit Court is a court of general jurisdiction; it has original jurisdiction of all justiciable causes not exclusively vested in some other court.
The Circuit Court has appellate jurisdiction as specified in this chapter.
The Circuit Court is a court of record and of continuous session.

The Circuit Court may be authorized by law to review the actions or decisions of administrative agencies, special districts or boards. Such review shall not constitute an appeal but an original action.

law.history: Amended 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 66, sec. 13, effective June 24, 2003. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 40, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1996. -- Created 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 475, effective January 2, 1978.
